intro: Dracophyllum tenuicaulis, commonly known as the slender-stemmed draco, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, cylindrical stems and small, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers during the spring and summer months. It is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Dracophyllum tenuicaulis is an important component of the local flora, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
